N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 686.7 - Program for supervised community residences

State Regulations
(a) Principles of compliance. (1)

Supervised and supportive community
residences shall provide a plan of services developed and delivered in
accordance with the requirements of Part 671 of this Title. (2)

Admission to a supervised residence shall
be based primarily on the applicant having a diagnosis of a developmental
disability (see glossary, section
686.99
of this Part) and that
his/her need for supervision and services can adequately be met. (3)

Clinical services delivered by
appropriately qualified parties, including assessment, direct service, and the
supervision and training of others providing services oversight at the
residence, shall be provided in accordance with each person's need. Such
services also include, but are not limited to, determining the appropriateness
of admission and continued need for service, and providing service delivery at
the residence. Clinical services delivered directly by the residence are
limited to those provided by parties in the professional titles identified in
section
686.13
of this Part. Nothing
herein shall be taken to preclude person's accessing additional clinical
services outside the residence either through their day program or any other
appropriately qualified provider. (b) Standards of certification. (1)
OPWDD shall verify that additional
written assessments, identified by those responsible for program planning, have
been obtained. (2)
OPWDD shall
verify that staff involved in planning a person's program understand why the
specific person outcomes were determined to be the most appropriate to address
the person's identified needs at this time. (3)
OPWDD shall verify that the plan of
services, on an overall basis, is being implemented as developed. (4)
OPWDD shall verify that the staff in the
community residence having program and/or supervision responsibilities for a
specific person know what their role and/or responsibilities are in carrying
out the person's plan of services. (5)
OPWDD shall verify that at least annually
there is a review, and recommendations are made on the following: (i) that the current residential placement is
appropriate to the person; (ii)
that the description of the person's general program activities in and out of
the residence and the person's participation in those activities reflects the
needs and interests of the person; and
(iii)
that the level of the person's
participation in the neighborhood/community activities is consistent with the
person's needs and interests. Notes
